page.title: 14Recollections of Street (1)
page.content: {Interview with Mrs.M Hart about {her book 'A Backward Glance'. } This book is a personal description of life in a typical country high street in the late 1930's,when the Street population was about{4,000.}Exciting events were holidays in{Weymouth}or {Weston,}and the{May Day Bazaar}at the {Crispin Hall}where there were{stalls, {Maypole and Morris dancing}and where the{infant May King crowned the Queen. This hall was the centre of all{social {activities _ band and school concerts, {dances,remembrance services,Clarks {operatic shows and once,even a circus, Street Club and Institute members could play{billiards,cards or chess there too. On her way to the{Board school {(now,a furniture store)}she might be tempted to spend her{1/2d pocket money on{sherbet dabs}or{raspberry jellies.
